column4: I can't seem to zoom out my desktop, anyone know how.  Also, how do you know if you are running compiz or not?
For the latter, ps ax|grep compiz|grep -v grep
If there is any output from that command, it is running
thanks
Try Super+Scroll to zoom
nothing happens, although compiz is running
Cab you explain what you mean by zoom is stuck?
well, I just don't know how to get it to zoom out, so all the windows are small and arranged up, and I can click to bring them back with the one I click on top
super is the windows button between alt and ctrl right?
Ah, do you have the scale plugin in ccsm?
Yes, super is what you think it is
Try selecting Extra in sys>prefs>appearance>visual effect, or install ccsm and make sure scale is enable
I dont think you want super+scroll (it is a different kind of zoom)
I don't have the extra option, I am using Xubuntu
Well in xfce, just look in ccsm and make sure Scale is enabled then use it by moving your mouse to the upper right
Well in xfce, just look in ccsm and make sure Scale is enabled then use it by moving your mouse to the upper right of your screen
I did that but it doesn't work.  There is something wrong here cause even the wobbly windows isn't working.  I think I need to use the intel video driver rather than the generic
hm. Can you show the output of ps ax|egrep "compiz|xfwm"|grep -v grep ?
That shows you do not have compiz running. Try compiz --replace from your Alt+F2 run dialog
hey, you are cool, how did you notice it isn't running from that out put, anyway, when I did replace, it went back to fallback, and this was issue: Blacklisted PCI ID 8086:2562 detected
Oh yes that is because the intel driver isnt too great and neither is your gpu chipset
hmm, ok, but it is 128 mb video card
how to I try another driver for my video card?
That's probably because debian is using an older version of the intel driver
